Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy with enough water to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can draw a plant that is wilting or dying without water to show what happens when plants do not get water.
The student can draw a side-by-side comparison of the same type of plant, one with water and one without, to show the effects of water supply on plant health.
The student can include any additional details like the sun or soil in their drawing to indicate that plants need more than just water, such as light, to survive.
